title: Annual Report 2024
code: # Grab output from ORCID where possible orcid <- staff_ids |>   pull(orcid_id) |>   na.omit() |>   fetch_orcid() |>   filter(publication_year == 2024) # Otherwise grab output from Scholar scholar <- staff_ids |>   filter(is.na(orcid_id)) |>   pull(scholar_id) |>   na.omit() |>   fetch_scholar() |>   filter(publication_year == 2024)

what: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff
title: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff
text: Download wrangle publication data Monash EBS academic staff

title: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff
text: spiderorchid R package provides tools retrieve research publications Google Scholar ORCID, DOIs, along CRAN package download statistics. tailored academic researchers EBS department wish consolidate analyze research outputs, also monitoring contributions CRAN. main functions included : fetch_scholar: Retrieves publication details Google Scholar given IDs. fetch_orcid: Retrieves publication details ORCID given IDs. fetch_doi: Retrieves publication details given DOIS. fetch_cran: Searches CRAN packages author’s name returns relevant package information number downloads last update date. package caches results within R session. fetch data multiple times, download .

title: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff
code: # Install the packages needed pak::pak(c("robjhyndman/pkgmeta", "numbats/spiderorchid")) library(spiderorchid) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

title: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff
text: staff_ids.csv dataset contains mappings researchers’ names respective ORCID Google Scholar IDs. useful linking identifying academic profiles across different platforms.
code: staff_ids #> # A tibble: 57 × 4 #>    first_name last_name orcid_id            scholar_id   #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>               <chr>        #>  1 Akanksha   Negi      0000-0003-2531-9408 Gcz8Ng0AAAAJ #>  2 Alan       Powell    <NA>                <NA>         #>  3 Andrew     Matthews  <NA>                <NA>         #>  4 Ann        Maharaj   0000-0002-5513-962X BZ07eocAAAAJ #>  5 Athanasios Pantelous 0000-0001-5738-1471 ZMaiiQwAAAAJ #>  6 Benjamin   Wong      0000-0002-1665-6165 Nneg6GAAAAAJ #>  7 Bin        Peng      0000-0003-4231-4713 5d3ZOm4AAAAJ #>  8 Bonsoo     Koo       0000-0002-7247-9773 OmK08lAAAAAJ #>  9 Brett      Inder     <NA>                Wx6eeWgAAAAJ #> 10 Catherine  Forbes    0000-0003-3830-5865 jm73LccAAAAJ #> # ℹ 47 more rows

title: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff

title: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff
text: fetch_orcid() function requires authentication ORCID. previously authenticated, prompt first run. just follow prompts, authenticated, downloading papers. want download papers ORCID IDs, need authenticate 2-legged OAuth. Follow instructions https://info.orcid.org/register--client-application-production-member-api/. avoid session, store token obtained orcid_auth() .Renviron file running usethis::edit_r_environ(). form ORCID_TOKEN=<token>.
code: staff_ids |>   filter(last_name %in% c("Negi", "Lydeamore")) |>   pull(orcid_id) |>   fetch_orcid() #> # A tibble: 15 × 9 #>    orcid_id authors publication_year title journal_name volume issue doi   page  #>    <chr>    <chr>              <int> <chr> <chr>        <chr>  <chr> <chr> <chr> #>  1 0000-00… "Micha…             2016 Choi… Bulletin of… 78     2     10.1… 293-… #>  2 0000-00… "Thiri…             2017 Indi… PeerJ        5      <NA>  10.7… e3958 #>  3 0000-00… "M. title: Download and wrangle publication data for Monash EBS academic staff
text: function retrieves information CRAN packages authored specified individual. returns data frame containing package name, number downloads, authors, last update date.
code: fetch_cran(c(   "Michael Lydeamore",   "Di Cook",   "Dianne Cook" )) #> # A tibble: 40 × 11 #>    package         date       title   description version authors url   cran_url #>    <chr>           <date>     <chr>   <chr>       <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <chr>    #>  1 cardinalR       2024-04-16 "Colle… "A collect… 0.1.1   "Jayan… http… https:/… #>  2 condensr        2023-08-30 "Acade… "Helps aut… 1.0.0   "Micha… http… https:/… #>  3 HospitalNetwork 2024-12-22 "Build… "Set of to… 0.9.4   "Pasca… http… https:/… #>  4 quollr          2024-03-05 "Visua… "To constr… 0.1.1   "Jayan… http… https:/… #>  5 brolgar         2024-05-10 "Brows… "Provides … 1.0.1   "Nicho… http… https:/… #>  6 eechidna        2021-02-25 "Explo… "Data from… 1.4.1   "Jerem… http… https:/… #>  7 fabletools      2024-09-17 "Core … "Provides … 0.5.0   "Mitch… http… https:/… #>  8 feasts          2024-09-25 "Featu… "Provides … 0.4.1   "Mitch… http… https:/… #>  9 geozoo          2016-05-07 "Zoo o… "Geometric… 0.5.1   "Barre… http… https:/… #> 10 GGally          2024-02-13 "Exten… "\nThe R p… 2.2.1   "Barre… http… https:/… #> # ℹ 30 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: github_url <chr>, first_download <date>, downloads <dbl>

title: Fetch packages from CRAN — fetch_cran
text: function searches CRAN packages author names. Note authors may use different name variations CRAN (e.g., "Di Cook" "Dianne Cook"), may necessary call function several variations.

title: Fetch packages from CRAN — fetch_cran
Fetch packages from CRAN — fetch_cran
text: author_names character vector containing authors' names form used CRAN. downloads_from date character string format "YYYY-MM-DD" specifying date start counting downloads. Default "2000-01-01". downloads_to date character string format "YYYY-MM-DD" specifying last date counting downloads. Default current date.

title: Fetch packages from CRAN — fetch_cran
text: data frame returning meta data package including total downloads `downloads_from` `downloads_to`.

title: Fetch packages from CRAN — fetch_cran
code: cran2024 <- fetch_cran(    author_names = c("Michael Lydeamore", "Di Cook", "Dianne Cook", "Hyndman"),    downloads_from = "2024-01-01",    downloads_to = "2024-12-31" )

what: Fetch article information given a DOI — fetch_doi
title: Fetch article information given a DOI — fetch_doi
text: Retrieves publications given list DOIs using DOI API formats structured tibble.

title: Fetch article information given a DOI — fetch_doi
Fetch article information given a DOI — fetch_doi
text: doi character vector DOIs.

title: Fetch article information given a DOI — fetch_doi
text: tibble containing article information.

title: Fetch article information given a DOI — fetch_doi
code: fetch_doi("10.1016/j.ijforecast.2023.10.010") #> # A tibble: 1 × 8 #>   doi             authors publication_year title journal_name volume issue page  #>   <chr>           <chr>              <int> <chr> <chr>        <chr>  <chr> <chr> #> 1 10.1016/j.ijfo… George…             2024 Fore… Internation… 40     2     430-…

title: Fetch publications from ORCID — fetch_orcid
text: Retrieves publications given ORCID IDs, returns tibble. publications DOIs returned. function uses ORCID API fetch DOIs, uses DOI API fetch publication details DOI.

title: Fetch publications from ORCID — fetch_orcid
Fetch publications from ORCID — fetch_orcid
text: orcid_ids character vector ORCID IDs.

title: Fetch publications from ORCID — fetch_orcid
text: tibble containing publications specified ORCID IDs.

title: Fetch publications from ORCID — fetch_orcid
text: function requires authentication ORCID. previously authenticated, prompt first run. just follow prompts, authenticated, downloading papers. want download papers ORCID IDs, need authenticate 2-legged OAuth. Follow instructions <https://info.orcid.org/register--client-application-production-member-api/>. avoid session, store token obtained `orcid_auth()` `.Renviron` file running `usethis::edit_r_environ()`. form ORCID_TOKEN=<token>.

title: Fetch publications from ORCID — fetch_orcid

what: Fetch publications from Google Scholar — fetch_scholar
title: Fetch publications from Google Scholar — fetch_scholar
text: Retrieves publications given Google Scholar IDs,  returns tibble. function retrieves publications given Google Scholar ID formats structured tibble.

title: Fetch publications from Google Scholar — fetch_scholar
Fetch publications from Google Scholar — fetch_scholar
text: scholar_id character vector Google Scholar IDs.

title: Fetch publications from Google Scholar — fetch_scholar
text: tibble containing publications specified Google Scholar IDs.

title: Fetch publications from Google Scholar — fetch_scholar
code: fetch_scholar("vamErfkAAAAJ") #> Warning: Coercing LHS to a list #> Error in dplyr::arrange(dplyr::select(output, dplyr::all_of(col_order),     dplyr::everything()), scholar_id, publication_year, title,     authors): ℹ In argument: `..3 = title`. #> Caused by error: #> ! `..3` must be a vector, not a function.

staff_ids — staff_ids
